intro: Orania brassii, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its attractive, velvety leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a low-growing perennial, often forming a dense rosette of foliage. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and bloom throughout the year under proper care. Orania brassii prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive.
